Title: P4869 Glossop Town Hall and Municipal Building Sash Window Refurbishment & Clock Tower Works
Description:
High Peak Borough Council are inviting tenders from suitably experienced contractors to complete brought forward works to the Glossop halls project public building refurbishment in the Centre of Glossop Town Centre. The wider project procurement of main contractor is currently in progress, the Council in addition is looking to tender and appoint either one or two contractors (one for both lots or, separate contractor for either lot) to commence works in the New Year. 

The works include refurbishment works of the existing; 
• Lot 1 - Municipal Building - Refurbishment of sash windows 
• Lot 2 - Town Hall - Sash window refurbishment, clock tower repairs/refurbishment and secrete guttering alterations. 

The contract and works itemised in the ITT documents are required to be fully completed and invoiced on or before the 31st March 2022 as part of the D2N2 grant funding agreement.

Title: Industry Data on the UK Audiovisual Sector
Description:
Ofcom has a requirement for third-party syndicated data support to further the Research & Intelligence team's understanding of the audiovisual market in the UK. While the team collects a large amount of its evidence directly from industry stakeholders, there are limits to what we can obtain this way. This particularly relates to the video-on-demand (VoD) landscape, as well as the pay TV market and the audio sector. 

This requirement has been split into three modules. Tenderers can submit a proposal for one, two or all three of the modules. Tenderers must be clear within their proposal as to which modules they wish to be considered and evaluated for.  Each module will be evaluated and awarded separately by Ofcom.

As a minimum, the service must deliver the following below. For each module, the service should preferably also provide equivalent or applicable metrics for the audio sector and the online industry.

Module 1: Content analytics

Detail on the hours and titles that comprise UK VoD providers' catalogues, for both subscription and free-to-view/ad-funded business models (i.e. subscription VoD, broadcaster VoD, ad-funded VoD - abbreviated as SVoD, BVoD and AVoD respectively).

Module 2: Market data

Subscriber, revenue and spend information for pay TV and VoD providers in the UK market.

Module 3: Consumer data

Information on consumers' attitudes and habits in respect to pay TV and VoD providers in the UK market.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Ampere Analysis Ltd|5 Hardwick Street, London, EC1R|COMPANIES_HOUSE|09146046|Yes|No]

Title: Application Development & Maintenance Services Transition Contract
Description:
G-Cloud 12 Call-Off contract for Application Development, Maintenance and Support Services (ADMS) to support and maintain LoB applications and deliver Operational Change activity, deliver Strategic Project activity and to provide services to support our Transition and Exit from the Hybrid tactical model to a strategic model.
Run and Maintain - To transition to a model, with an ADMS function that runs and maintains 
supported services and allows us to balance the demands of operational change against the need to move at pace with work that supports our Agency strategy. Application Services will deliver Run and Maintain - Incidents, Requests and Changes required to keep existing services working at their current standard.
Operational change - Application Services will deliver Business as Usual Operational Changes - Changes requested by directorates to improve their day-to-day operations, on applications that it manages and maintains. Project sized Operational Change will be delivered by Service Providers, governed by Service Governance and Digital Delivery.
Continued provision of 'run and maintain' aspects of Application Services:
•	Delivery of Strategic Application Services Projects
•	Support in migration to new Target Operating Model, developing internal Agency capability in Application 
•	Services Development, Maintenance and Support
•	Transition and Exit Management activities

Title: CWC21023 - Wolverhampton Independent Health Complaints Advocacy Service (WHACS)
Description:
The City of Wolverhampton Council intends to procure a new Independent Health Complaints Advocacy Service (IHCAS) locally branded as Wolverhampton Health Advocacy Complaints Service (WHACS).

The Health and Social Care Act 2012 transferred the responsibility of commissioning NHS Complaints Advocacy services from Central Government to Local Government. The current Independent Health Complaints Advocacy Service contract ends on 31 March 2022. The Council plans to procure a stand-alone replacement Service which will commence in April 2022, and end in October 2023 to align with other statutory advocacy services.

Wolverhampton is looking for an experienced provider who understands the key aspect of the Service is the focus on empowering and supporting individuals to go through the complaints procedures for health services, and to assist them in finding a resolution to their complaint(s) about the care or treatment they have received. Supporting individuals to go through to the Health Service Ombudsman may also be necessary.

The provider will deliver services that meet the legal requirements as described in the Health and Social Care Act 2012 and any current or future regulations.

The service will enable local people to make and resolve complaints in relation to the following services:
• All NHS Trusts and NHS Bodies including NHS Foundation Trusts,
• Family Health Services provided for the NHS by GPs, Dentists, Opticians or Pharmacists and other health care practitioners,
• Clinical Care Groups or ensuing organisation/s,
• Private health care establishments if the treatment has been paid for by the NHS,
• All other health services commissioned by NHS funding.

Please see the tender documents for further information.

Light Touch Regime:
The subject matter of this procurement process relates to the delivery of services which are listed to in Chapter 3, Section 7 to the PCR 2015 regulations. As such the full regime set out in the regulations will not apply to the award of the contract. Consequently, the procurement process adopted by the Commissioners has been developed in accordance with Regulation 76 of the regulations and in particular in accordance with the fundamental public procurement principles of transparency and equal treatment. For the avoidance of doubt this means that the Commissioners have adopted an open procedure described in the associated tender documents.

Title: Provision of Public Space Closed Circuit Television (CCTV) Surveillance Monitoring and Operating Staff - AWARD
Description:
The Council has set up a comprehensive CCTV system throughout the urban, open spaces, park facilities and some rural areas of the Borough. This tender is for the provision of operators to manage and monitor the equipment from the control room.
      
      The primary objectives of the scheme are to provide a safe Town Centre & Open Spaces (including parks) for the benefit of those who live, work, trade, visit and enjoy the facilities of Bedford Borough and to reduce the fear of crime and the occurrence of crime in our local communities. In addition, the control room currently provides out of hours services (OOH) for the Council, Highways Team and partner agencies, for example Housing Associations
      
      The system has been in operation since 1995 and currently consists of 600+ cameras situated throughout the urban and rural areas areas of Bedford and Kempston and within Council owned car parks. In addition, it proactively & reactively monitors various third party camera systems (subject to service level agreements). 
      
      The control room for this system, which has recently been upgraded , is located in the centre of Bedford and consists of a bank of colour monitors; custom built desk facilities for CCTV operators; digital recording via hard drives; reviewing and copying facilities; printers and all the associated services for communications with Police, retailers, licenced premises and businesses operating within the town.

Title: Interim Head of Digital Communication Manager
Description:
The GDC has awarded a contract for a  temporary Interim Digital Communications Manager. The purpose of the role is to maintain and develop content on our existing digital products while improving evaluation and our understanding of our users and their needs, which will be used to recommend and deliver some improvements in 2022 and then recommend and longer-term improvements to support the GDC's new Corporate Strategy from 2023.

The role involves management of digital communication and engagement products that provide essential information and influential engagement to more than 100,000 dental professionals across the UK, external stakeholder organisations and the public. The General Dental Council's primary aim is to ensure patient safety and public confidence in dentistry through proportionate and effective healthcare regulation.

Areas of Responsibility: 

- Manage the transition from current to new supplier of website hosting and maintenance, ensuring continuity of service and standards
- Working with a supplier, contribute to the development of improved evaluation, understanding of user needs and journeys and recommendations for short-and long-term improvements to support our Corporate Strategy from 2023-2025
-Manage relationships with digital providers for the website and social media products and monitor budgets for digital maintenance and development
- Work closely with the IT team on website security and updates
- Ensure and agree a clear and prioritised pipeline of projects and work for the digital communication products, working with colleagues across the organisation to develop digital content that meets communication objectives
-Undertake and oversee the publication of content on the GDC website and other digital channels, including social media, ensuring it is in keeping with GDC tone of voice and agreed key messaging
-Input to the development and delivery of integrated communications and engagement plans 
-Analyse data and user behaviour on digital channels, including the website and social media, and use as evidence basis to develop content, demonstrate performance of digital channels and improve user experience.-
-Monitor social media to gather intelligence about the wider issues that may affect the GDC.

Title: Cambridge City Council - Communication, Marketing and Digital Engagement
Description:
The Cambridgeshire and Peterborough Region of Learning (CPRoL) is a Covid-19 response project to address entrenched barriers to skills development, civic engagement, and employment opportunities for all children and young people, targeting those most at risk of poor life outcomes and furthest from the labour market (aged 15 to 24 years).
The current and next generation of workers face a challenge of an unprecedented scale, and requires a solution that utilises innovative technologies, and a strategic use of digital channels and platforms to support agility of delivery on a population scale, complemented by more targeted one-to-one support where needed.
Cambridge City Council is the lead partner in a project that has developed a bold solution to meet the scale of the challenge posed by Covid-19 upon young people, delivered through a smart, universal passport to learning, skills and opportunity. CPRoL will provide a unified, place-based approach to improving skills and career outcomes, particularly for those with low social mobility. It engages leadership at a local level, connects existing networks of employers, formal and non-formal learning, and a technology platform that uses data from these providers to create digital pathways to more inclusive employment.

Title: SC21055 - Independent Cost Consultancy Services
Description:
Kent County Council (the "Council") is looking to procure a single supplier NEC4 Framework Contract for purchase of ad hoc independent cost consultancy services supporting the Council's Major Capital Programme Team (MCPT) with the projects relating to the construction of major highway and transportation schemes. Support will also be required to other teams across the Growth, Environment and Transport Directorate for highway and transportation projects and contracts. 
The required Framework Contract will be used as a basis for purchasing services for individual Work Orders linked to separate works projects as and when required.  The Council will place individual Work Orders using the NEC4 Professional Services Short Contract.

The Council requires new service arrangements from on 1 April 2022. The Initial Contract Period will be 36 months, with an option to extend for up to a further 24 months (via two separate extension periods of 12 month each).

The supplier will be required to:
(a)	have demonstrable suitable experience, competence and capability in providing independent cost consultancy services relating to the construction of major highway and transportation schemes;
(b)	comply with ISO9001 (Quality Management System) or comparable standards; and
(c)	be an accredited member of RICS or similar relevant professional organisation.
A full specification of requirements will be provided to tenderers as part of the Invitation to Tender stage of this procurement procedure. 

Please register an interest in this opportunity online (via the Kent Business Portal) to gain automatic access to the 'Call for Competition' documentation, including the Selection Questionnaire.

Leicester City Council and Leicestershire County Council invited Tenders for the provision of a Probation Health Trainers Service. In this instance, Leicester City Council led this joint procurement on behalf of both Authorities.

We sought to commission a service provider to deliver a health trainers service to offenders on community orders or license across both Local Authority populations (within Leicester and Leicestershire). Health Trainers services support adults who wish to make a change towards a healthier lifestyle but who are unlikely to make and maintain this without individual support.

The Authorities wish to ensure that procurement opportunities are open to small and micro local enterprises and voluntary and community sector organisations and appreciate the very important role these play in the local economy. Tenders from these organisations were particularly welcomed.

The proposed Contract will be for an initial period of 3 years to commence on 1st April 2022, with an option to extend, subject to satisfactory performance outcomes and agreement by the Authorities, for a further period or periods, up to a total of 24 months, taking the contract term, including all optional extensions, to a maximum of 5 years.

It is the Authorities' preliminary view that TUPE is likely to apply in respect of this Contract.

Leicester City Council conducted this procurement under the Light Touch Regime for Social and Other Specific Services, as set out in the Public Contract Regulations 2015 (PCR), at Section 7 (Regulations 74 to 77) and Schedule 3. The procurement process was not conducted under the Public Contract Regulations 2015; however, it was similar to that of an Open procedure. The Process, unlike an Open Procedure, included the flexibility, as allowed under the Light Touch Regime with various evaluation stages as detailed in the Invitation to Tender documentation.

The Invitation to Tender documentation contained further details.

Title: P0871 - Accommodation and support to address homelessness at point of discharge service - AWARD
Description:
The Council wishes to establish a Contract for the provision of Accommodation and Support to citizens who are homeless at the point of discharge.  This will include but not limited to:
      
      o Provide good quality accommodation that meets the needs of the citizens including those who are bariatric, and wheelchair users.
      o Provide flexible person-centred support ensuring that support is delivered in response to the client's needs and allows them to maintain accommodation and improve their health and wellbeing 
              outcomes.
      o Provide the lead and support which will assist clients to navigate and gain access to appropriate services, including but not limited to health care, substance misuse, education and/or support to gain 
              employment.
      o Follow the principles of the No Wrong Door Network to ensure that all service users are enabled to access the correct support by referring or enabling access (including getting clients to appointments) to 
              other services as appropriate.
      o Provide support that promotes social integration and financial stability.
      o Regularly review the person-centred support agreement to up-date, record and monitor the progress of each client.
      o Developing the skills and capabilities of individuals and raise their aspirations, enabling them to be independent and self-sustaining. 
      o Provide a service that is timely and available at the point of need.
      o Develop, maintain and coordinate effective working relationships with external agencies
      o Maintain and develop support knowledge and expertise.
      
      The Contract will last for 5 years (unless terminated under the terms and conditions of contract) with the provision to extend for up to an additional 2 years subject to requirements, funding and satisfactory performance.
      
      The contract will be awarded on the following basis to one provider for the whole contract.
      
      The Council will be using its free to use e-tendering system (in-tend) for the administration of this procurement process and potential suppliers must register with the system to be able to express an interest. If you wish to express an interest in this opportunity please click on the following link to access https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc/ and submit your details to register. You will then be sent details on how to log on which will enable you to download all relevant Invitation to Tender (ITT) documentation.  
      
      If you are unable to register with In-tend or have any questions or problems on how to use this web site please either email us at: cps@birmingham.gov.uk or call CPS Helpdesk on 0121 464 8000.
      
      Your completed tender submission should be returned by noon on 5th January 2022 via the 'in-tend' system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/birminghamcc

Title: GB-Telford: Hackney Carriage and Private Hire Inspection & Testing Service
Description:
The provision of a Hackney Carriage and Private Hire Inspection & Testing Service for vehicles licensed by Telford & Wrekin Council. 
      Bidders must be an approved DVSA Vehicle Testing Station located within the Borough of Telford & Wrekin.
      
      The main provisions of the inspection & testing service is to:
      
      •Ensure that licensed vehicles are mechanically safe and meet the standards of the DVSA MoT.
      •Ensure that licensed vehicles are compliant with Telford & Wrekin Council's licence conditions.
      •Ensure that trailers towed by licensed vehicles are of a safe construction and suitable for the towing vehicle.
      •To carry out a meter accuracy test for hackney carriages on the Council's measured mile

Title: Strategic Media Planning Agency call-off Contract
Description:
***** THIS IS AN AWARD NOTICE, NOT A CALL FOR COMPETITION *****
This procurement is being concluded following a mini competition under the Crown Commercial Services RM6125, Campaign Solutions Lot 2

Brief Description of Requirement
The Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy (BEIS)  are looking to appoint a new strategic media planning agency under the Campaign Solutions framework, in order to develop media strategy and media planning for campaign media activity on an ad-hoc basis. 
BEIS have an urgent need for media strategy and planning services for upcoming priority campaigns in 2022 and beyond. Including the continuation of Build Back Better, Fairer and Greener campaigns which focus on initiatives to help recover from the pandemic and improve growth and productivity in the UK. 
Work will be briefed, and budget agreed on a project-by-project basis, in line with costs agreed within the call off.  As this is a call off contract for multiple projects individual assessments will be undertaken for each campaign with a PASS form submitted for Cabinet Office spend approval. 

BEIS Communications are seeking to appoint a strategic media planning agency on a call-off basis to respond to media strategy and media planning requirements from policy teams that contribute to the Build Back Better (including Help to Grow Management and Digital) and Build Back Greener, (including climate change) cross government priorities. 
BEIS wish to develop an ongoing relationship with a strategic media planning agency   to develop effective campaign strategies and media propositions, in line with campaign objectives.

Title: SOL - Children's Advocacy and Independent Services  - AWARD
Description: SMBC seeks to commission Advocacy and Independent Visitor Services to support Children within the borough. SMBC Vision is for Solihull to be a place where everyone has equal chance to be healthier, happier, safer and more prosperous; where all children and young people are loved and values by their families and communities and thrive and succeed. Our purpose is to be an organisation that improves lives rather than focuses on services. This includes enabling and supporting people with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND) to take a full and active part in community life.  There is a statutory duty to provide an Advocacy Service to looked after children, children who are not looked after but are in need, and to care experienced young people, for both formal and informal complaints under the 1989 Children Act.  Additionally, the Act states that children and young people should be able to secure the support of an advocate in putting forward their wishes and feelings with regards to a change to be made in the service they receive, or the establishment they live in, without this having to be framed first as a specific complaint. There is a statutory duty to provide an Independent Visitor service outlined within this specification under the Children Act 1989 - New section (23ZB) and subsequently amended by the Children & Young Persons Act 2008. Local Authorities are required to appoint an Independent person for children and young people looked after whenever an authority considers an appointment to be in the best interests of a child. SMBC want to commission this service to support children and young people within the borough with this service.
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [National Youth Advocacy Service|Tower House, Tower Road, Birkenhead, Merseyside, United Kingdom, CH41 1FF|NONE||No|No]

Organisation Name: Surrey and Borders Partnership NHS Foundation Trust
Title: Contracts Finder Award Notice - Integrated Substance Misuse Treatment-Subcontract
Description:
i-access is the substance misuse service for Surrey and is part of Surrey and Borders NHS partnership Trust (SABP). The service is jointly provided by SABP and Public Health, Surrey County Council under a cooperation agreement. The Child and Family Safeguarding Pilot is part of the i-access service and has a number of months of funding remaining with commitment to secure future funding already being explored. It is part of the i-access service. The Pilot has brought substance misuse workers into the child and family teams in order to support parents with substance misuse issues.
This procurement was for subcontracted aspects of i-access. The provider will work collaboratively with SABP and Public Health. The provider's staff will work with SABP staff to deliver the i-access service. They will be based in the SABP i-access bases and in Surrey County council bases for the
Child and Family safeguarding pilot.
The i-access bases are:
- Farnham Road Hospital, Guildford
- Abraham Cowley Unit, St Peters Hospital site, Chertsey
- Wingfield Centre, Redhill.
The Child and Family Safeguarding Service bases are:
- Guilford Council - St Francis House
- Woking Council - Quadrant Court
- Walton Council - Ashley Park House
- Redhill Council - Consort House.
SABP and Public Health did not require any Service Provider to try and reduce the financial envelope. The financial envelopes are below:
- Main Sub-contract -£456,988 per annum (for 3 Years with the option to extend for 2 periods of 12
months each)
- Family Safeguarding -£378,000 per annum (maximum funding envelope) for 1 Year on a pay as you go basis based on actual posts/staff recruited in-month and up to10.00% overhead.
Service Providers were informed that bids under the financial envelope stated above, would not be advantageous. Any underspend funding will be re-invested back into the SCC and SABP Co-operative. We understand when delivering a service there can be unexpected costs. Mitigation for those costs are discussed and agreed in the programme board, on which the successful Provider will sit. The financial approach to this contract is one of openness, transparency and collaboration.
Contact Address 1: Third Floor, Leatherhead House, Station Road
Supplier [Name|Address|Ref type|Ref Numb: [Westminster Drug Project|Kingsway House, 103 Kingsway, London, ALTRO, WC2B 6QX, UNITED KINGDOM|NONE_OTHER||No|No]

Title: Redevelopment of the LCR BeMore Apprenticeship Portal & creation of Mobile Application
Description:
We are looking to procurement the services for the redevelopment of the existing Liverpool City Region (LCR) Be More apprenticeship website (https://be-more.info) for the Liverpool City Region Combined Authority (LCRCA) as well as the introduction of a mobile application.
The pandemic has seen a huge shift in digital behaviours and expectations and the proposed redevelopment is to create a one-stop solution that not just provides a regionalised apprenticeship service but also serves as a city region digital beacon for careers advice and guidance such as progression pathways and local industry relevant information to a wider audience. Presently, as apprenticeships, skills and careers are so closely linked, there is a requirement for these sources of information to be pulled together in one place and delivered in a more aspirational and engaging way. A three year contract with options to extend annually up to a maximum of two years (1+1) (reviewed on an annual basis) will be awarded to the successful supplier.

Title: Diving, Confined Space & Remote Camera Inspections of Highway Structures
Description:
Corserv on behalf of Cormac Solutions wishes to appoint a suitably qualified, competent and experienced contractor to provide a service for diving, confined space and remote camera inspections of highway structures.

Cormac Solutions is responsible for the inspection and maintenance of highway structures which mainly take the form of bridges, culverts and retaining walls. All highway bridges and culverts which are the responsibility of Cormac Solutions receive a biennial general inspection. Approximately 20% of these structures present problems of access so that a diving or remote camera inspection is required as part of the general inspection. Cormac Solutions wishes to appoint an appropriately trained and qualified engineer working for a company which specialises in this type of work. This contract enables such a programme of inspections to take place and a full picture of the condition of all highway structures to be ascertained.

The contract will initially be for 2 years with an optional extension for a further 2 year term.

The intention is to appoint the most economically advantageous tenderer based on 60% Price, 30% Quality and 10% Social Value.

Title: RE21617 - BEIS - Baseline Non-Compliance of Products Purchased by Consumers: Smart Speaker - Invitation to Quote
Description:
The final date and time for the submission of bids is Friday 17th December 2021 at 11:00

DO NOT apply directly to the buyer.

All tender information MUST be submitted through the Delta eSourcing Portal.

Brief Description of Requirement

The Department for Business, Energy, and Industrial Strategy (BEIS); Office for Product Safety and Standards (OPSS) is an appointed market surveillance authority, responsible for (via the Secretary of State) enforcing the General Product Safety Regulations (GPSR) within the UK.  

The test results stemming from this tender will form part of a larger testing programme currently being undertaken by OPSS. The aim of this testing programme is establish the baseline levels of non-compliance across a range of products. This tender is focusing on one product from that range. The results of this testing programme will help to inform future OPSS decision-making and aid impact measurement.

The successful bidder is to provide test results for 50 different examples of the below electrical product to verify their compliance against the Radio Equipment Regulations. The test house will therefore receive 50 x 3 multiples of each sample to allow for the full suite of tests to be carried out. Therefore, the test house will receive 150 items in total. 50 x 3 = 150.
 
Smart Speaker Samples: 

The identified test methods applied should follow the relevant standards set out in the Regulations as applicable to the smart speaker samples and should be carried out to the following standard: 

•	EN 62368:2014 +AC:2015
o	Clause 4 General requirements (Limited Assessment)
o	Clause 5.3 Protection against electrical energy sources
o	Clause 5.4.9 Electric Strength 
o	Clause 5.4.3 and 5.4.2 Clearance, creepage distances (Limited Assessment)
o	Annex F Marking and Instructions and
•	Regulation 39 CE/UKCA marking  
•	Regulation 8 or 18 Postal address of economic operator
o	Annex G.4.2 Direct plug-in equipment (Limited clauses of BS 1363)
•	EN 55032:2015 +A11:2020              
•	EN55035:2017 

Please ensure you review all attached information for a full understanding of this requirement. All attachments can be found in the Document Uploads tab within the Delta eSourcing Portal. 

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement. 

To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and the follow instructions to 'Log in' 

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: SJXSF5WQDA

All submissions will be assessed in accordance with the Public Procurement Regulations that apply to this opportunity.

Responses must be received by the date and time in the tender documentation; responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the Delta eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered by the Contracting Authority further for this opportunity. Interested organisations should ensure that they allow a sufficiency of time, prior to the deadline to allow all sections to be completed in full and any attachments to be uploaded.

As a user of the Delta eSourcing Portal you will have access to the Delta messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you, as well as other messages and updates in relation to any specific tender event. Please note that any and all information secured outside of the messaging service, shall have no merit or worth and should not be relied upon by any organisation submitting a tender response. 

Please note it is your organisations responsibility to access these messages on a regular basis to ensure you have sight of all relevant information applicable to this opportunity.

The Contracting Authority expressly reserves the right:

If the Contracting Authority decides to enter into a contract with any successful organisation(s), this does not mean that there is any guarantee of subsequent contracts being awarded. Any expenditure, work or effort undertaken prior to contract award is accordingly a matter solely for the commercial judgement of your organisation in doing so.

Title: 3073/JN - Sustainable Aviation Fuels - Innovation Centre: Aviation Characterisation Laboratory Equipment (16 Lots)
Description:
The University of Sheffield (UoS) with funding from the European Regional Development Fund (ERDF) is establishing a Sustainable Aviation Fuels Innovation Centre (SAF-IC) to support and promote the production and characterisation of decarbonised and sustainable aviation fuel. To complement our research capability, we are looking to procure a range of test equipment approved to various ASTM (American Society for Testing and Materials) standards as well as other internationally recognised standards where appropriate.

The SAF-IC will be sited alongside a concentration of University translational research assets which form the University of Sheffield Innovation District, within the Sheffield City Region (SCR) Advanced Manufacturing Innovation District (AMID). The building consists of several dedicated test cells designed to host a range of aviation fuel component experimentation, as well as a bespoke 200m2, Aviation Characterisation Laboratory. The ASTM approved test equipment procured under this tender will add to the assets employed in the Aviation Characterisation Laboratory and will focus on both Tier-1 and Tier-2 fuel specification and property testing. Each item of laboratory equipment has been specifically selected to complement the research capability and desired range of  testing. Each item must be certified to validate a subset of ASTM test standards.

Lot 1	Automated Water Solubility Test Device - ASTM D6304
Lot 2	Dynamic Viscosity Measurement Device - ASTM D7042 
Lot 3	Simulated Distillation Unit based on Gas Chromatography - 
                ASTM D2887 and IP 406
Lot 4	Automated Lubricity Measurement Device - ASTM D5001
Lot 5	Automated Test Device for Determining Specific Heat 
                Capacity by Differential Scanning Calorimetry - ASTM E1269
Lot 6	Automated Freeze Point Test Device - ASTM D2386
Lot 7	Automated Flash Point Test Device - ASTM D56, ASTM 
                D3828 or ASTM D93
Lot 8	Digital Density Meter - ASTM D4052
Lot 9	Conductivity Response - ASTM D2624
Lot 10	Automated Atmospheric Distillation Analyser - ASTM D86, IP 
                123, ASTM D7344 and ASTM D7345
Lot 11	Automated Vapor Pressure Device - ASTM D6378
Lot 12	Automated Total Acid Number - ASTM D664
Lot 13	Automated Tensiometer - ASTM D1331
Lot 14	Automated Trace Sulphur Analyser - ASTM D5453
Lot 15	Automated Smoke Point Analyser - ASTM D1322
Lot 16	Automated Vapor Pressure Device - ASTM D6378

This is an EU / FTS open exercise. The ITT can be downloaded by registering and expressing your interest on the University`s e-tendering system https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sheffield 

If you have any questions or comments in relation to this tender they must be submitted via the In-tend system, this can be accessed at https://in-tendhost.co.uk/sheffield

Completed tenders must be returned through the same e-tendering system.

Title: GB-Newcastle Upon Tyne: T21-0046 Radiation TID Facility
Description: We require an x-ray irradiation facility capable of providing a total ionising dose to electronics components at a rate between 0.5 and 3 Gy(Si)/s to a total of 1000 Gy(Si). The x-rays must have sufficient energy to penetrate into exposed electronic components to a depth of a few mm, this means that a minimum energy requirement is 100 keV but higher energies are desirable, subject to safety constraints. The system must be compliant with UK national standards for safety; Safety of Machinery standard: ISO 13849-1:2015, and the Ionising Radiations Regulations - IRR 2017. This means that there must be shielding to reduce the radiation to background levels outside of the testing chamber and that there must be a secure interlock system with a safe failure state such that the system will not function with the door open, as well as a keyed initiation system. This system should be provided with all relevant cooling and control and command systems needed for operation, as well as a dosimeter capable of tracking the dose provided inside the chamber. The facility will be used in a laboratory installed on the second floor and so must be small enough to transport into that space.

Title: House Waste Clearance - Phase III
Description:
The requirement is to remove waste on behalf of the Authority. This is a large warehouse illegally filled
with waste under an environmental permit between 2013 and 2015 and is a high risk fire site.

Phase I: Technical feasibility and planning. This is a desk based study to determine the structural
integrity of all buildings, to provide a costed plan for the testing and assessment of waste and establish
where the waste can be taken off site.

Phase II: Clearance of waste from all areas that do not require construction and/or demolition to safely
access and remove waste.

Phase III: Clearance of waste from buildings which do require construction and/or demolition to safely
access and remove waste.

Title: NHS Sheffield CCG : 24/7 Online Mental Health Platform
Description:
The South Yorkshire Integrated Care System (ICS) is seeking to establish a common digital offer for the South Yorkshire public. This common offer and platform will integrate to national services, i.e., NHS App, NHS Login and NHS.UK, and will seek to integrate a suite of applications that will offer common services such as booking appointments and managing medications, as well as offering some condition or public cohort specific and personalised services.  SY ICS is targeting this service to become operational in 2022/23.  The Mental Health specific service will initially operate as a standalone service but must have sufficient integration capability to integrate with the common offer/platform to ensure an excellent experience for the public that is joined up, and in line with the NHS X Digital Technology Assessment Criteria.  The provider of the Mental Health service will be required to work with South Yorkshire ICS Digital team to establish this integration as part of delivering the Mental Health Service and the implementation and transition to a SY common digital offer for the public

The purpose of the service is to provide an accessible and discretionary digital mental health service to individuals aged 16 years and above in South Yorkshire, ensuring  age appropriate safeguarding measures are in place.

To provide immediate open access to Mental Health information ( local and national)

Improve connectivity to mental health services and support through the use of digital services built around the needs and views of service users

Prevent mental health issues escalating and reaching crisis point, by providing access to therapeutic interventions and counselling support. 

An experienced work force will be provided and all counsellors will be registered with an appropriate professional body i.e. BACP or equivalent.

To complement existing mental health crisis services and digital offers in place

To provide a service that will help to respond to the anticipated increase in demand arising from the Covid 19 pandemic.  

The digital platform will enable individuals to access self-assessments and self-management resources and an online peer support community, moderated by mental health professionals.

Improve partnership working across the mental and physical health and social care system across South Yorkshire , through engagement and awareness of the platform across the system.

The Contract will be for a term of 18 months with the opportunity to extend for a further 18 months subject to mutual agreement between the successful Bidder and the Authority. The maximum term of Contract is consequently 3 years. The value given in this notice is for 18 months.

Title: UK SBS - PS21258 - Data Discovery, Design and Analyse project for the Ofgem programme's future data science function.
Description:
***** THIS IS AN AWARD NOTICE, NOT A CALL FOR COMPETITION *****

The final date and time for the submission of bids is Friday, 10th December 2021 at 11:00am

Brief Description of Requirement

UKRI is working in partnership with Ofgem to develop the future delivery model of the fund for the Ofgem Strategic Innovation Fund ('the SIF'). This is a new, multi-year innovation programme to transform energy networks innovation and position the UK as the Silicon Valley of energy systems innovation. 
To support this programme we are interested in designing a data science function which adds additional value to the users and customers of the programme. These include internal teams, the public, innovators (funded through the programme and otherwise), investors, policy makers, and the energy networks themselves.
Innovate UK is progressing on its journey to becoming a data-driven organisation. With the Ofgem programme just starting, we have an opportunity to look at how we better capture, analyse and use data to offer additional value. With this we want to consider how approaches could be applied and scaled across the whole organisation. The project will therefore require close working with the Innovate UK data team, as well as the Ofgem Strategic Innovation Fund team.

How to Apply

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) will be using the Delta eSourcing Portal for this procurement.

To register on the Delta eSourcing portal please use the link https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and follow the instructions to register.

If you are already registered on the Delta eSourcing Portal and wish to participate in this procurement, please use the link: https://www.delta-esourcing.com/ and the follow the instructions to 'Log in'

Once you are logged into the system you will be able to link yourself into this procurement using the Access Code: 56YF8G6596
Additional Text:
DO NOT APPLY DIRECTLY TO BUYER

All submissions will be assessed in accordance with the Public Procurement Regulations that apply to this opportunity.

Responses must be received by the date and time in the tender documentation; responses received outside of the deadline or not sent via the Delta eSourcing portal will not be accepted or considered by the Contracting Authority further for this opportunity. Interested organisations should ensure that they allow a sufficiency of time, prior to the deadline to allow all sections to be completed in full and any attachments to be uploaded.

As a user of the Delta eSourcing Portal you will have access to the Delta messaging service which facilitates all messages sent to you and from you, as well as other messages and updates in relation to any specific tender event. Please note that any and all information secured outside of the messaging service, shall have no merit or worth and should not be relied upon by any organisation submitting a tender response. 

Please note it is your organisations responsibility to access these messages on a regular basis to ensure you have sight of all relevant information applicable to this opportunity.

The Contracting Authority expressly reserves the right:

i.	not to award any contract as a result of the procurement process commenced by publication of this notice; and

ii.	to make whatever changes it may see fit to the content and structure of the procurement; and under no circumstances as part of your organisations participation in this opportunity, will the Contracting Authority be liable for any costs incurred by any organisation as a result. If the Contracting Authority decides to enter into a contract with any successful organisation(s), this does not mean that there is any guarantee of subsequent contracts being awarded. Any expenditure, work or effort undertaken prior to contract award is accordingly a matter solely for the commercial judgement of your organisation in doing so.

About UK Shared Business Services 

UK Shared Business Services Ltd (UK SBS) brings a commercial attitude to the public sector; helping our contracting authorities to improve efficiency, generate savings and modernise.

Where UK SBS is not named as the Contracting Authority within the documentation, UK SBS will be acting as an agent on behalf of the Contracting Authority.

Our broad range of expert services is shared by our customers. This allows our customers the freedom to focus resources on core activities; innovating and transforming their own organisations.

For full details of our partner base please review the following link: http://www.uksbs.co.uk/services/procure/contracts/Pages/default.aspx

Title: Insurance Brokerage Services
Description:
***THIS OPPORTUNITY IS CLOSED. THIS IS A CONTRACT AWARD NOTICE***
The Financial Reporting Council sets the UK accounting, audit and actuarial standards and administers the Corporate Governance and Stewardship Codes. As the competent authority for audit in the UK the FRC sets auditing and ethical standards and monitors and enforces audit quality. The FRC works in the public interest. Our work is aimed at investors and others who rely on company reports, audit, and high-quality risk management.    
The Financial Reporting Council is committed to 
•	supporting the creation of a new regulator, the Audit, Reporting and Governance Authority (ARGA), which will be a strong and fit for-purpose regulator and provide increased confidence in the UK market. 
•	Protecting and improving audit and reporting quality.
•	Making company reporting fit for the future.
•	Supporting the creation of the audit of the future
•	Ensuring that the world-leading UK Corporate Governance and Stewardship Codes make the UK a great place to do business, helping support Covid-19 recovery and UK prosperity.
We also monitor and take action to promote the quality of corporate reporting and operate independent enforcement arrangements for accountants and actuaries. Further information about our role can be found at www.frc.org.uk.

This Notice was related to our Insurance Brokerage Services Project.

The FRC appointed a registered insurance broker/broker firm to procure competitive insurance covers and premiums, net of broking commission.  Schedule A contains details of the wide portfolio of insurances maintained by the FRC. The appointed broker will be  providing the following services: -


•	advice and assistance as required on all aspects of the FRC's insurance needs;
•	advice on, and negotiation of, renewal terms and premiums for the policies detailed in Schedule A;
•	advice on the levels of cover held and/or indemnities to be maintained under these policies;
•	advice and assistance on the processing of claims.

Full details are available in the attached Invitation to Tender (ITT) and associated documents.

Organisation Name: National Institute For Health And Care Excellence
Title: Digital media planning and campaign management
Description:
NICE is seeking a suitable supplier to provide digital media planning and campaign management over the next 2 years, including but not limited to:

2.1.	Digital marketing strategy: 
•	Working with us to shape our digital marketing strategy, capturing and understanding our needs and those of our audiences (including users of NICE guidance e.g. frontline healthcare professionals and NHS commissioners of healthcare products and services, and the life sciences industry e.g. pharmaceutical companies, medical or digital health technology developers). 
•	Provision of recommendations with a clear rationale, to ensure cost-effectiveness of paid digital marketing. 
•	Supporting NICE in the development of an 'always-on', insight-led approach to digital marketing, scheduling and continuously optimising activity (within the remit of our budget).
2.2.	Campaign planning and delivery: 
•	Planning and delivering paid digital advertising, ensuring effective tracking of campaign objectives and associated goals, thorough analysis and evaluation of campaign performance data.
•	Ability to produce static campaign assets (e.g. images, carousels) and adapt these for different channels, if required.
•	Ability to embed key accessibility standards into any assets created for use within digital content marketing campaigns.

Due to the urgency of the work, Suppliers must:

Express an Interest by email no later than 17:00 13th December 2021

Submit their bid no later than 12 noon 17th December 2021

Title: 10127.1 Air quality station
Description:
Norwich City Council provides a range of statutory and non-statutory services to the city of Norwich including waste and recycling, planning, housing and events.

The council currently owns an air quality station which is more than 25 years old and contains equipment which is no longer DEFRA compliant. 
We are seeking the removal and replacement of this station to remain DEFRA compliant.

The scope of the tender is for the removal of the current air quality monitoring station and the supply, installation and commissioning (including staff training) of a new kerbside air quality station. 
The removal of the old station and supply of the new station should coincide as best as possible, so data loss is minimised.

Please download tender documents and upload completed tenders using the link: 
https://in-tendhost.co.uk/norwich/aspx/Home

Organisation Name: YORK TEACHING HOSPITAL NHS FOUNDATION TRUST
Title: Further subscription of N365 Licenses
Description:
"The Microsoft Enterprise Subscription Agreement can only be aligned with one Licensing Solutions Partner (LSP). The Trust went to market back in Aug/Sept 2020 for the N365 ESA 3 Year contract. All licenses, both initially added from start of ESA, as well as any subsequent license requirements must be purchased and reported against this agreement.
 
Insight won the ITQ, and the unit costs and the SKU's now required for Feb, March and April purchases are the same unit costs and SKU's put forward in our winning bid. These 4,000 licenses are continuation of these same costs that were market-tested at the time. It is not possible for any other supplier to provide these licenses under the same ESA contract, and nor is it permitted for the Trust to set up a new ESA for these requirements. The very definition of the Enterprise Agreement, is that it's an estate-wide commitment, hence the heavily-discounted license costs via the Healthcare N365 Memorandum of Understanding."
Contact Name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

Title: National Framework Agreement for the provision of Asset and Contract Lifecycle Management Services
Description:
The Countess of Chester Hospital NHS Foundation Trust's Commercial Procurement Service wishes to establish a new framework to enable and support continued asset and contract lifecycle management within the NHS and wider public sector.  The purpose of this Framework is to enable a provider to increase efficiency against traditional contract letting and management methods, whilst maintaining or improving high standards of delivery.

The Countess of Chester Hospital NHS Foundation Trust's Commercial Procurement Service anticipates appointing the highest scoring Tenderer (which has met the minimum requirements which are set out in these ITT documents) to supply the services detailed within the specification at SCHEDULE A FRAMEWORK AGREEMENT SPECIFICATION.
Attachments: F015 - List of Eligible Users.pdf F015 FTS Contract Notice.pdf F015 (2022) ITT.pdf F015 (2022) SCHEDULE A - Specification.pdf F015 (2022) SCHEDULE C - Prerequisites.docx
Additional Text:
Suppliers Instructions
How to Express Interest and bid for this ITT:
1. Browse to the esourcing portal
https://www.nhssourcing.co.uk
and click on viewcurrent opportunities
2. Select the title of the ITT.
3. Review the ITT, Framework Agreement Specification, Prerequisites and List of Eligible Users (you may do this without registering).
4. Register your organisation on the eSourcing portal (this is only required once).
5. Accept the portal terms and conditions and click 'continue', Enter your organisation and user details, Note the username you chose and click 'Save'when complete. You will shortly receive an e-mail with your unique password (please keep this secure).
6. Login to the portal with the username/password.
7. Click the 'PQQs/ITTs Open To All Suppliers' link. (These are PreQualification Questionnaires or Invitations to Tender open to any registered supplier)
8. Click on the relevant PQQ/ITT to access the content.
9. Click the 'Express Interest' button at the top of the page. This will move the PQQ/ITT into your 'My PQQs/My ITTs' page. (This is a secure area reserved for your projects only). You can now access any attachments by clicking 'Buyer Attachments'in the 'PQQ/ITT Details' box.
10. Responding to the ITT. Click 'My Response' under 'PQQ/ITT Details', you can choose to 'Create Response' or to 'Decline to Respond' (please give a reason if declining) You can now use the Messages function to communicate with the buyer and seek any clarification. Note the deadline for completion, then follow the on-screen instructions to complete the ITT. There may be a mixture of online and offline actions for you to perform (there is detailed online help available) You must then submit your reply using the 'Submit Response' button at the top of the page. If you require any further assistance please consult the online help, or contact theTendering help desk.

Title: Community  Architect Team for Benhill Estate (London Borough of Sutton)
Description:
The London Borough of Sutton is exploring ambitious plans for the regeneration of seven of its housing estates in and around Sutton town centre. The programme presents one of the most significant development opportunities in the borough and will play an important role in improving housing standards, enabling housing growth and transforming Sutton town centre.

To facilitate delivery of this programme, the Council is seeking to appoint a highly skilled and experienced Estate Regeneration Community Architect Team with a proven track record of delivering similar services to act as lead designer and consultant, to focus on the Benhill Estate.

London Borough of Sutton is conducting the procurement using the National Framework Partnership Lot 2 Architectural Services. 

Under the terms of the Framework, the firms who responded to the Expression of Interest issued earlier this year, are invited to submit detailed bids under the mini competition process.

Title: (NU/1589-46) PR for Driving the Electric Revolution Industrialisation Centres
Description:
DER-IC require a PR agency with strong industry connections. The agency will be supplied with assets to work from, including branded materials and internal support. The agency will be required to gain regional and national exposure for DER-IC, showcasing new innovations, events, case studies, expansions and more. 
Applicants responding must be able to demonstrate:
•	A network of regional and industry contacts
•	Evidence of working within the manufacturing and/or engineering sector
•	Evidence of existing clients' exposure featured in regional and national publications
•	Examples of reporting methods, including KPIs.
To raise awareness of DER-IC in the UK and more widely and build the profile of our brand with the media and through them B2B customers. 
In doing so, the objectives of the campaign are:
•	to support B2B engagement through the promotion of relevant case studies, new innovations, partner and business testimonials. 
•	to highlight research and innovation breakthroughs 
•	profile our experts as thought-leaders in their field.

Title: Community Based Wellbeing Specialist Dementia Services (Lots 7-12)
Description:
Kent County Council (KCC) are commissioning Community Based Wellbeing services that are designed to promote wellbeing for older people (aged 55+), adults with physical disabilities, adults with sensory impairments, and people with dementia.

This procurement process will procure the following Contract Lots:
Lot 7 - Post Diagnostic Specialist Support in the Community for People with Dementia and their Families in West Kent
Lot 8 - Post Diagnostic Post Diagnostic Specialist Support in the Community for People with Dementia and their Families in East Kent
Lot 9 - Post Diagnostic Specialist Support in the Community for People with Dementia and their Families in North Kent
Lot 10 - Dementia Coordinator Service in West Kent
Lot 11 - Dementia Coordinator Service in East Kent
Lot 12 - Dementia Coordinator Service in North Kent (including Medway)

The Contracts awarded for Lots 7, 8 and 9 will commence on 1st April 2022 and will run for a period of 3 years (expiring 31st March 2025), with the option for two extensions of up to one year each at the discretion of the Council, unless terminated in accordance with the published Conditions of Contract. 
The Contracts awarded for Lots 10, 11 and 12 are being procured by KCC on behalf of Kent & Medway CCG and will commence on 1st April 2022 and will run for a period of 2 years (expiring 31st March 2024), unless terminated in accordance with the published Conditions of Contract. 

Currently, Lot 9 does not cover the Medway council geographical area. The contract may be varied in the future to include the provision of a Post Diagnostic Specialist Support in the Community for People with Dementia and their Families in this area.

Further information on the breakdown of Lots and Services can be found within the Invitation to Tender Documents.

Selection Questionnaire responses must be submitted via the Kent Business Portal by 12 noon on the 27th August 2021.

Questions and Communication 
Please direct all questions and communication through the Kent Business Portal via the Messages facility.

Title: Ofgem 2021-191 Analytical Support and Economic Advice on Retail Resilience
Description:
The role of this contract is to provide economic advice and analytical support to inform Ofgem's approach to delivering its retail financial resilience action plan - in particular actions 9 and 10. Actions 9 and 10 relate to mutualisation risk associated with renewable obligation (RO) payments and credit balances and developing a stronger regulatory framework for supplier financial resilience. This will require the supplier to:
* Provide analysis and modelling on retail market related data to inform Ofgem's policy development - including wholesale prices, hedging strategies and mutualisation costs
* Quantify the costs and benefits of potential policy options to inform resolution of issues such as costs of supplier failure
* Advise on economic theory and concepts, and offer potential approaches to resolving problems - as they relate to the issues in scope of this project.

Title: IA2432 Overnight Residential and Community Short Breaks North Staffordshire
Description:
Staffordshire County Council is seeking to secure a suitable provider to provide services to meet the Assessed Needs of Children & Young People with Disabilities & provide short breaks from caring for their families/carers'. 

The Service will ensure that the child is supported to become as independent as possible, & their families are supported in a way which enables them to maintain their caring role & responsibilities for their child, and to sustain an everyday family life, including spending time with siblings
. 
Services must be available to enable all eligible children & young people and their families across North Staffordshire, including rural & less populated areas, to have equitable access to quality overnight residential short breaks & community short breaks based.

The provider will be expected to offer appropriate support packages for a range of different needs and complexity, that will be individually tailored & relate to the individual assessment of needs.  They should build on each family's strengths & assets wherever possible. 

The Service shall comprise of: 
Service 1: Residential Short Breaks 
(1) the provision of accommodation & care at the Provider's premises based on access for 5 Children & Young People with Disabilities at any one time at weekends (Friday night to Sunday afternoon) and school holiday periods (Monday  to Friday), provided in accordance with the regulatory requirements of Ofsted, and reflecting the need to ensure 'compatibility' of the Children & Young People with Disabilities using the service at any particular time; 
(2) the provision of accommodation & care outside of school holidays & weekends, upon request when there is an emergency situation and it is not appropriate for the Child or Young People to remain at home (in the geographical area covered by the service); 
 


Service 2: Community Short Breaks 
(1) the provision of support for eligible Children & Young People with Disabilities in community settings, to enable the child or young person to participate in agreed, age appropriate activities that will contribute to their personal development & meet their assessed needs.  This could include leisure & recreational activities.
(2) the provision of four after school clubs in term time (39 weeks per year), lasting three hours. Four staff are to supervise each club & provision should be made for up to eight Children & Young People with Disabilities to attend each session.
(3) the provision of focused, time limited assessments for the eligible Children & Young People with Disabilities on an ad hoc basis.

Title: How can policy better support SMEs in the pathway to Net Zero
Description:
The Climate Change Committee (CCC) plans to publish a report in 2022 to advise Government on business action, including a section on SMEs. The report will summarise the actions needed from SMEs to contribute to the Sixth Carbon Budget, evaluate the climate policies in place that currently impact SMEs and suggest new or strengthened policies. 

To inform this publication, the CCC is tendering a project 1) to understand the actions that priority SMEs groups should be taking to meet the Sixth Carbon Budget 2) to evaluate existing SME-focussed policies and to highlight where these leave gaps and 3) to suggest changes to existing policies or new/alternative policies that would engage more SMEs in reducing their emissions effectively. 

Given timescales for publication, the tendered work needs to be delivered by end of April 2022, at a cost of £25,000 - £40,000 plus VAT. 

The CCC's past reports are available here: http://www.theccc.org.uk/reports/.

**** See Specification for more detail ****

Title: Decarbonising Airfields
Description:
The requirement is for a supplier to collect data on the carbon emissions produced by General Aviation (GA) airfields and operations.

The research will aim to provide a preliminary evidence base of carbon emissions in the GA sector, existing infrastructure, future opportunities for decarbonisation and green infrastructure, and the cost of green infrastructure.

This research will be Phase 1 of a two-phase research project. Phase 2 will seek to understand, using data collected in Phase 1, where airfields require the most support, what change and/or implementation can make the most difference, and consider case studies.

This procurement was finalised via the Research Marketplace.

Notice Identifier: Broads Peat Discovery Project Nature for Climate Peatland Grant Scheme (NCPGS)
Title: Broads Peat Discovery Project Nature for Climate Peatland Grant Scheme (NCPGS)
Description:
The Broads Peat Partnership will deliver a Nature for Climate Peatland Discovery Project. Covering 13 sites in each valley of the Broads National Park, including 7 delivery partners (Broads Authority, Natural England, National Trust, Norfolk FWAG, RSPB, Norfolk and Suffolk Wildlife Trusts, Palladium and a number of private landowners): (Palladium are responsible for developing a new economic model to blend public and private finance). 

The Broads Authority invites you to tender for ecological (vegetation and water vole), hydrological, peat and historic environment surveys to prepare sites for Restoration from 2023. 

Seven work packages can be bid for separately or in combination. The work packages, covering the 13 sites, are: 
•	Hydrological assessment
•	Peat survey
•	Vegetation survey
•	Protected Species - water vole study
•	Historic Environment Assessment 
•	Development of site Monitoring and Restoration Plans

The output of this work will directly lead towards the restoration of these sites for nature, carbon and water management in further planned grant schemes.

Title: Community Based Wellbeing Services: Lots 4, 5 and 6
Description:
Kent County Council are looking to commission Community Based Wellbeing services that are designed to promote wellbeing for older people (aged 55+), adults with dementia, adults with physical disabilities, adults with sensory impairments, and adult carers.
The range of Community Based Wellbeing services will be split into both geographic and service Lots in order to best meet the differing needs and support requirements of the eligible Kent population. This is the second phase of a staggered procurement process. 

This procurement process will procure the following Contract Lots:

Lot 4 - Universal Support in the Community in Ashford, Canterbury & Swale
Lot 5 - Universal Support in the Community in Dartford, Gravesham & Swanley
Lot 6 - Specialist Support in the Community for Adults with a Physical Disability

The Contracts will commence on 1st April 2022 and will run for a period of 3 years (expiring 31st March 2025), with the option for two extensions of up to one year each at the discretion of the Council, unless terminated in accordance with the published Conditions of Contract. 

Further information on the breakdown of Lots and Services can be found within the Invitation to Tender Documents.
Tender documents must be submitted via the Kent Business Portal by 12 noon on the 12th August 2021.

Key Dates

Invitation to Tender (ITT) dispatch:	7th July 2021
Tender return:	12th August 2021 12:00 noon
Tender evaluation and clarification, including potential negotiation meetings: 13th August - 24th September 2021
Potential issue of Invitation to submit Final Tender: 27th September 2021
Final tender return:	4th October 2021
Issue award letters:	1st December 2021
Standstill period complete (contract award):	13th December 2021
Mobilisation:	1st January - 31st March 2022
Service Commencement:	1st April 2022


Questions and Communication 

Please direct all questions and communication through the Kent Business Portal via the Messages facility.

Title: Sub-orbital Launch Market Study Scope
Description:
***** THIS IS AN AWARD NOTICE, NOT A CALL FOR COMPETITION *****

Option 1
This procurement is being concluded following a mini competition under the CCS Research Marketplace DPS (RM6018) 

Brief Description of Requirement

This study aims to analyse the market potential for sub-orbital launch from the UK.

The government's Spaceflight Programme aims to create conditions enabling the UK to be the first country in Europe to achieve commercial spaceflight - generating growth for the UK's economy and establishing the foundations for ongoing market growth and commercial sustainability by 2030.

The sub-orbital market is one that has not been explored in detail by previous UKSA studies. The aim of this work is to fill the evidence gap, to explore the suborbital market in the UK. To understand what currently exists, what exists elsewhere and what could exist in the UK.

By understanding where the demand falls, as well as the UK's strengths, weaknesses opportunities and threats, the Government can maximise the benefits for the emerging UK suborbital market and improve the UK's global competitiveness through informed decision making.

To deliver on these high-level objectives an in-depth report is required.

Title: Provision of independent mobility assessment service for blue badge applications
Description:
The aim of the Blue Badge Scheme is to help disabled people with severe mobility or cognitive (visible or non-visible (hidden) disabilities to access goods and services, by allowing them to park close to their destination. The scheme is open to eligible people with a disability irrespective of whether they are travelling as a driver or as a passenger.

The scheme provides a national range of on-street parking concessions to Blue Badge holders. It allows them to park without charge or time limit in otherwise restricted on-street parking environments, and allows them to park on yellow lines for up to 3 hours, unless a loading ban is in place.

Local authorities are responsible for the day-to-day administration and enforcement of the scheme. They are responsible for determining and implementing administrative, assessment and enforcement procedures which they believe are in accordance with the governing legislation.

Southend Borough Council (SBC) have an independent mobility assessment contract in place until the end of February 2022 with the aim of providing robust, quality outcomes for citizens and now wish to tender for a 3-year contract starting from 1st March 2022 with two options to extend for a further 12 months.

Title: Thurrock Town Tidy and Beautification Project (Welcome Back Fund) - AWARD
Description:
Thurrock Council has been awarded funding from Government under the Welcome Back Fund (WBF) to deliver projects within key location around the borough, with a view to improving business resilience to COVID-19, strengthening the local economy, improving the aesthetic of our towns and instilling confidence in local people that it is safe to visit and shop here.
      
      To re-energise our centres we will be organising local high street events, projects to beautify our towns, improved street furniture to make the areas more welcoming and we will be running a major advertising and social media campaign from November 2021- March 2022 encouraging Thurrock to 'Shop Safe Shop Local'. An important element of this work is to improve the appearance of our high streets with the aim of improving perceptions and increasing footfall, while at the same time building community spirit and developing a sense of community ownership. We are looking to appoint an organisation that has expertise in this area and can support the objectives outlined in the Specification document, which is accessible through the In-Tend portal.

Title: PROVISION OF INDEPENDENT SEXUAL VIOLENCE ADVISORS (ISVA'S)
Description:
The service is being commissioned by the Durham Police and Crime Commissioner (DPCC). 

The services within this contract relate to all victims/survivors of rape or sexual violence residing in County Durham and Darlington even if they choose not to report to the police. 

All documents are available free of charge to potential bidders for these Specific services and must be downloaded from the procurement portal as requested. 

The specification provides the details of the service to be delivered by the provider as part of an integrated response to rape and sexual violence that will be tailored to meet the needs of our local County Durham and Darlington population. A high quality and cost-effective service model must embrace a concept of integrated, specialist interventions and a range of assessment and support services through defined processes and care pathways.
Independent Sexual Violence Advisors (ISVAs) are expected to provide a holistic service that ensures victims/survivors of rape or sexual assault, regardless of their age, gender, disability, ethnicity or sexual orientation receive timely and appropriate practical and emotional support in a safe, secure and confidential environment. The service must be flexible, easily accessible, tailored to the needs of the individual and will play a vital role in meeting the needs of victims/survivors. It is essential that there is effective integrated working across all partners involved in delivering related services.
Contact Address 1: Police HQ, Aykley Heads, CO Durham

Title: Student Bus Services
Description:
Scope of services

This scope of bus services is to undertake a Competitive Dialogue Procedure for the bus service provision for the University of Derby, Derby Campus and Buxton & Leek College, Buxton Campus.  We are seeking collaboration and partnership with potential service operators to work with the University and support the delivery of its travel and transport planning though sustainable and innovative bus services.

Key deliverable outcomes for these bus services include:
•	Providing safe and efficient bus services that enable travelling to our sites for all
•	Reducing operating costs wherever possible
•	Lowering our carbon emissions and supporting the University's environmental policy and sustainable travel plan.
The University is keen to explore opportunities for collaborative services that can reduce the operating cost of the bus services and options to explore utilising and partnering with existing commercial services and re-instating passenger fares should be encouraged.

Collaborative partnerships which can also assist in delivering sustainable travel with reduced carbon emissions should also be encouraged.

The pre-pandemic value of this Unibus service is £624k per year.  The University will consider longer term contracts working in partnership where investment may be required to deliver demonstrable objectives.  For example, 5 + 5 year terms will be considered where deliverable and strategic transport objectives can be evidenced over that period of time.

To apply for this opportunity you will need to register on our Oracle portal - https://www.derby.ac.uk/services/finance/procurement-suppliers-and-tendering/ and follow the guidance on how to find an respond to the tender at: https://www.derby.ac.uk/services/finance/procurement-suppliers-and-tendering/supplier-info/suppliers-responding-to-negotiations/.
Attachments: Bus contracts Scope 130121.docx Evaluation and Award Criteria.docx Mutual Non-Disclosure Agreement.doc Form T1 _ Standard Supplier Questionnaire (SQ).docx Bus services procurement summary timetable.docx
Additional Text: The competitive dialogue procedure will be used for clarification, specification and optimisation of final tenders.

As a result of COVID-19 Pandemic Urology have not been able to meet the demands of the service and waiting times have increased as a result.  Restrictions remain in place around social distancing so there is a requirement to look to an external provider to provide appropriately skilled outpatients and theatre teams as a managed solution.

The service is expected to be required for 15 weeks. However, due to uncertainties caused by Covid-19, this may be extended under the contract for up to 26 weeks total service length.
